value.title: Your Brain on AI: Artificial Intelligence is “creating a world without choices”
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence goes far beyond just music or clothing recommendations which poses unforeseen risks for all of us. In his new book “The Loop”, NBC News Technology correspondent Jacob Ward warns AI is eroding our ability to make decisions on our own.

value.title: AI can predict signs of a heart attack within a year — from a routine eye test
value.excerpt: LEEDS, United Kingdom (StudyFinds.org) – An artificial intelligence ... described in the journal Nature Machine Intelligence, could revolutionize heart therapy, according to the researchers.

value.title: Drive smarter decision-making with explainable machine learning
value.excerpt: Executives are missing out on a crucial pathway to smarter and more efficient decision-making with explainable machine learning.

value.title: AI chip startup Ceremorphic comes out of stealth mode
value.excerpt: A host of novel chip features including analog computation will deliver a more-efficient, more reliable, more secure AI processor for multiple markets, CEO Venkat Mattel claims.

value.title: China targets deepfakes in proposed regulation governing deep learning AI technologies
value.excerpt: Providers of services that manipulate images and videos will be required to verify user identities and respect social morality.

value.title: The IRS is reportedly looking for ID.me alternatives amid privacy concerns
value.excerpt: The Treasury Department and Internal Revenue Service (IRS) are reportedly looking for alternatives to the controversial facial recognition software ID.me, according to a report by Bloomberg. As Bloomberg notes,

value.title: Containers and Kubernetes underpin more edgy, artificial intelligence efforts
value.excerpt: Containers are popular, and surveys show rise in Kubernetes adoption as their primary orchestration engine. This is key as applications grow more complex.

value.title: Bias in AI is spreading and it’s time to fix the problem
value.excerpt: To unlock the full power of automation and create change, we must understand how and why bias in AI happens and what to do about it.

value.title: Union Minister Dr Jitendra Singh says, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Digital Medicine are critical to future healthcare
value.excerpt: Science & Technology; Minister of State (Independent Charge) Earth Sciences; MoS PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances, Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr Jitendra Singh said here today that

value.title: Report: 62% of orgs use voice technology to increase revenue
value.excerpt: A new report found that many companies are using voice technology to identify new business opportunities, and to increase revenue.

value.title: Could AI be used to cheat on programming tests?
value.excerpt: A new study finds that a freely available AI tool could be used to cheat on coding assignments. But how serious is the threat?

value.title: Meta builds AI Research SuperCluster for future AI and the metaverse
value.excerpt: Meta believes that its new AI Research SuperCluster (RSC) will be among the fastest AI supercomputers running in the world once it’s fully built. The supercomputer is being constructed in phases. In the current phase 1,

value.title: AI Weekly: AI supercomputers and facial recognition to verify taxpayers’ identities
value.excerpt: Meta (formerly Facebook) announced an AI supercomputer. Also, more revelations about the IRS' use of facial recognition have come to light.

value.title: Building global AI with local impact in an AI economy
value.excerpt: Thanks to tech advances in the AI economy that enable remote work, orgs developing AI can now collaborate with people from almost anywhere.

value.title: The Grain Of Truth In The Critique Of Musk, Tesla And Full Self Driving (FSD)
value.excerpt: The internet erupted last week following the publication of a full-page ad in the New York Times asserting “Don’t be a Tesla Crash Test Dummy” and impugned “Elon Musk’s ill-advised Full Self-Driving robot car experiment.

value.title: Why Massachusetts is ground-zero for the fight against facial recognition
value.excerpt: Massachusetts has had a number of cities ban facial recognition in the absence of federal laws as conversations about the technology heat up.

value.title: Waymo Sues California DMV Over Robotaxi Safety Data
value.excerpt: The driverless car company — which is owned by Google parent Alphabet Inc. — operates an autonomous taxi fleet in San Francisco, and the question in the suit is whether public safety-related data can be a trade secret.

value.title: Achieve AI Success With A People-First Data Strategy
value.excerpt: As the pandemic has accelerated digital transformation, organizations are successfully deploying and scaling AI projects across more sophisticated, critical scenarios.

value.title: Use a web browser plugin to quickly translate text with Amazon Translate
value.excerpt: Web browsers can be a single pane of glass for organizations to interact with their information—all of the tools can be viewed and accessed on one screen so that users don’t have to switch between applications and interfaces. For example, a customer call center might have several different applications

value.title: CausaLens gets $45M for no-code technology that introduces cause and effect into AI decision making
value.excerpt: One of the most popular applications of artificial intelligence to date has been to use it to predict things, using algorithms trained with historical data to determine a future outcome. But popularity doesn’t always mean success: predictive AI leaves out a lot of the nuance,

value.title: How Logistics Procedure Optimization With AI Can Help Diminish The Transportation Sector's Environmental Impact
value.excerpt: However, AI might. If we want to transform our current course, we need the private sector's commitment. In the words of Paul Polman, "Sustainability makes good business sense, and we're all on the same team at the end of the day.

value.title: Can Artificial Intelligence Boost Mental Healthcare Accessibility?
value.excerpt: Boston-based researchers are evaluating whether artificial intelligence could advance mental health care accessibility by helping providers identify patients who may be struggling.

value.title: Waymo sues state DMV to keep robotaxi safety details secret
value.excerpt: A court may decide whether Waymo's business interests outweigh the public's right to understand the safety issues around self-driving cars

value.title: China Proposes Increased Regulation of Deepfakes and Other AI Synthesis Systems
value.excerpt: The Cyberspace Administration of China (CAC) has proposed a new set of draft regulations to govern AI-aided synthesis systems, including deepfakes, virtual reality scenes, text generation, audio, and other sub-sectors of AI media synthesis – a field in which China produces a prodigious number of academic papers and innovative research projects each month.

value.title: Lessons In AI Regulation From A Tech Founder
value.excerpt: Although AI is unlikely to replace human oversight completely, it's crucial for businesses and leaders who want to take advantage of the benefits of AI technology to get ahead of the regulations so they aren't left scrambling.
